verses.text: 向 神認罪求赦的必歡呼 （大衛的訓誨詩。）過犯得蒙赦免，罪惡得到遮蓋的人，是有福的。（本節在《馬索拉抄本》包括細字標題）

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'admit guilt'.
Forms a nominal phrase referring to a person or thing.
A psalm of instruction or teaching.
Often used in formal or religious contexts for receiving favor.
Refers to the covering of sins in a spiritual sense.
Lit. 'have blessing', used idiomatically as 'blessed'.
Refers to the authoritative Hebrew text of the Old Testament.

verses.text: 心裡沒有詭詐，耶和華不算為有罪的，這人是有福的。

words.note: Lit. 'have sin', used idiomatically as 'guilty'.

verses.text: 我閉口不認罪的時候，就整天唉哼，以致骨頭衰殘。

words.note: Connects a verb phrase to '時候' to form a temporal clause.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Describes physical decline due to spiritual distress.

verses.text: 因為你的手晝夜重壓在我身上，我的精力耗盡，好像盛暑的乾旱。（細拉）

words.note: More literary than '白天黑夜'.
More formal/literary for 'mid-summer'.
A Hebrew term of uncertain meaning, often a musical or liturgical direction.

verses.text: 我向你承認我的罪，沒有隱藏我的罪孽；我說：「我要向耶和華承認我的過犯」；你就赦免我的罪孽。（細拉）

words.note: Used to negate past actions.
Often implies serious wrongdoing or karmic evil.

verses.text: 因此，凡是敬虔的人，都當趁你可尋找的時候，向你禱告；大水氾濫的時候，必不能達到他那裡。

words.note: Refers to reverence and devotion to God.
A formal and respectful way to address God.
Often used for natural disasters or uncontrolled spread.

verses.text: 你是我藏身之處，你必保護我脫離患難，以得救的歡呼四面環繞我。（細拉）

words.note: Literally 'place for hiding the body'.

words.definition: to escape from, be free from
so as to, in order to

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew 'Selah', likely a musical or liturgical direction.

verses.text: 我要教導你，指示你應走的路；我要勸戒你，我的眼睛看顧你。
你不可像無知的騾馬，如果不用嚼環轡頭勒住牠們，牠們就不肯走近。

words.note: 不可 (bùkě) means 'must not'.

verses.text: 惡人必受許多痛苦；但倚靠耶和華的，必有慈愛四面環繞他。

words.definition: to rely on, to trust in
words.note: Often implies spiritual reliance or trust in God.
The Hebrew name for God, YHWH, often rendered as 'the LORD'.
Here, it forms a noun phrase 'those who rely on Jehovah'.

verses.text: 義人哪！你們要靠著耶和華歡喜快樂；所有心裡正直的人哪！你們都要歡呼。

words.note: Lit. 'righteous people'
Indicates addressing someone or something.
The Hebrew name for God.
Indicates addressing someone or something.
